description: Explicit taste preferences for photo sorting - overrides learned patterns
top_priorities: Parent expressions (should be engaged, not vacant)

highly_valued: Parent and baby both have good expressions
Subjects engaged with each other (eye contact, shared activity)
Emotional moments: mischief, joy, intimacy, playfulness

deal_breakers: Unclear what's happening in the photo
Major technical issues (very blurry, bad lighting)
negative_factors: Subjects looking in different directions (unless intentional)
Too zoomed out to see expressions

contextual_notes.parent_expressions: Parent expressions matter as much as baby's. A photo with perfect baby but vacant parent is not share-worthy.
contextual_notes.interaction_over_solo: Photos showing interaction between parent and child are preferred over solo baby shots, unless baby is doing something particularly special.
contextual_notes.technical_threshold: Technical quality is important but not sufficient - a technically perfect photo of an ordinary moment is still Storage.
contextual_notes.burst_philosophy: In burst mode, only keep the absolute best 1-2 photos. Don't share from every burst.

share_philosophy: I want photos that capture genuine moments of connection, emotion, and personality - especially between parent and child. Technical quality matters, but the emotional content and interaction quality matter more.
